body.p:
Frankfort.K.Y. Decem 20th 1863.
To his excelency Governor Bramlette
Dear Sir

I have been confined here now verey near five years and hope that you will take in to consideration my case. I was sentenced for the term of ten years.. charged with burgulary..thare is a petition ^in^ the Secratarys office Sighned by all the keepers of this institution Some Six or Seven months.. and I hope my dear Sir that you will take my case into consideration and release me. I assure you that your Leniencey will not be misssplaced, as it is my intention to lead a diferent life intirely from my past, if your excelency will Show clemency in my case. I have friends that will provide for me.. I am blind, and tharefore laouber under more disadvantage than is the lot of but few of mankind..
Hoping that you will not overlook this humble petition

I Remain your verey humble Servant
Charles Sulivan
